UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Stores user account information, excluding sensitive authentication data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

email.description: User's email address for login and communication.

registrationDate.description: Date and time when the user registered.

definition.description: Stores user account information.  Includes denormalized 'userId' for authorization independence.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier for the user.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and clarity for the DAMII application. User data is stored under `/users/{userId}`. This structure ensures that each document's security can be evaluated independently, avoiding complex hierarchical `get()` calls in security rules. 

Denormalization is key. The `UserAccount` data includes all necessary information for user-specific operations.

This structure enables straightforward `list` operations within each user's private data, fulfilling the QAPs. Since access to `/users/{userId}/*` is restricted to the user identified by `{userId}`, unauthorized listing of other users' data is prevented. The use of path-based ownership ensures secure data access and manipulation.
